snippet: An Egyptian-brokered truce appeared to be taking effect on Tuesday, ending four days of cross-border fighting between Israel and Palestinian militant groups in Gaza.
abstract: Israel and the Islamic Jihad militant group in Gaza indicate that they will abide by an Egyptian-brokered truce, ending four days of cross-border fighting and rocket attacks; both groups issue warnings that continued calm will depend on the other side refraining from violence.

byline.original: By ISABEL KERSHNER and FARES AKRAM
byline.contributor: Isabel Kershner reported from Jerusalem, and Fares Akram from Gaza.

lead_paragraph: An Egyptian-brokered truce appeared to be taking effect on Tuesday, ending four days of cross-border fighting between Israel and Palestinian militant groups in Gaza.

headline.main: Unannounced Truce Calms Violence in Gaza
headline.print_headline: Truce Aims to Calm Israel-Gaza Border Strife
